article: Football is, I suppose, the most popular games in England. One had only to go to one of the important  matches  to see this. One can see kinds of people there, shouting and  _  for one side or the other. One of the most  _  thing about football in England to a stranger is the  _  knowledge of the game which even the  smallest boy  seems to have. He can tell you the names of the players in  _  of the important teams. He  _  photos of them and knows the result of large numbers of matches. He will tell you  _  he expects will win such and such a match,  _  his opinion is usually as  _  as that of men three or four times his  _  . Most schools in England take  _  seriously--much more seriously than nearly all the schools in other countries,  _  lessons are all important and games are left for one's own arrangements . In England, it is believed that  education  is not only a matter of filling a boy's mind with facts in the  _  ; it also means character training; and one of the  _  ways of training character is by means of games,  _  team games, where the boy has to learn to  _  with others for his team, instead of working just for himself alone. The school therefore arranges games and matches for its  _  . Football is a good team game and it is good exercise for  _  .
